intro: Specklinia echinata, commonly known as the spiny leaf orchid, is a tropical epiphytic plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spiky foliage. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks, utilizing its aerial roots to absorb moisture and nutrients from the environment. Its leaves are usually thick and leathery, adapted to retain water in humid conditions. Specklinia echinata produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink, often blooming during the rainy season.
